image.altText: Politicians and supporters celebrate outside Legislative Council.

props.synopsis: A $1.13 billion stadium on the edge of the Hobart CBD has been approved by Tasmania's upper house and will be built, satisfying a key condition for the state's AFL licence.

title.children: It's a 'Yes'. Hobart's AFL stadium gets final parliamentary approval

image.altText: Sign reads "Burnie Supreme & Magisterial Courts" on red brick building

props.synopsis: Bo Popowski's defence lawyer told the courtroom this was the first time he had heard the word murder used for the case and that he would need time to speak to his client.

title.children: Man alleged to have stood on 4yo has charge upgraded to murder

image.altText: Tasmania AFL licence press conference

props.synopsis: When it comes to the Macquarie Point stadium in Tasmania, there is clearly something deeper at play than seats, concrete and a roof. You simply couldn't vote for it otherwise, writes Chris Rowbottom.

title.children: Tasmania isn't quite done with having awkward conversations with the AFL

image.altText: a bushfire in the background in the Tasmanian bush

props.synopsis: Evacuated residents of a beachside community on Tasmania's east coast are warned it is unsafe to return to their homes as a bushfire remains active.

title.children: Residents told to stay away as fire on Tasmania's east coast remains active

image.altText: A crowd of people marching with banners and signs calling for an end to native forest logging in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: The reformed Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act runs hundreds of pages long - so what will actually change and will protests become a thing of the past?

image.altText: Man in a suit speaking with hand gestures in front of green grass.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian parliamentarians have censured a minister for breaking his word to a local football club after it attended an election campaign media event with the opposition.

title.children: Tasmanian minister censured for 'vindictive' withdrawal of footy club's funding

image.altText: Mitchell Starc is illuminated by the floodlights at the Gabba

props.synopsis: A day of tough, fluctuating Test cricket kickstarts the Ashes series at last as Mitchell Starc and Joe Root carry their sides despite concerns about what lies beneath.

title.children: Saved by Starc, Australia's selection gamble exposes its underbelly

image.altText: Yuval Raphael wearing a black fitted suit with long tassels hanging from arms, arms out, holding mic, singing on stage

props.synopsis: Public broadcasters in Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands say they will not participate in next year's event and more are expected to follow.

title.children: Eurovision heavyweights to boycott after Israel allowed to perform

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: Working from home can positively impact the mental health of Australian men and women in different ways, according to a new study of more than 16,000 people.Â

title.children: Analysis of 16,000 people shows how working from home impacts mental health

image.altText: Black and white vision showing birds eye view of a boat driving through the water.

props.synopsis: The US military says it has killed four men in a strike on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the Eastern Pacific

title.children: US military says it killed four men in strike on suspected drug vessel

image.altText: Two nurses walk down a hospital corridor seen from behind.

props.synopsis: A new report from Australia's peak doctors' body says private health insurance is increasingly failing to deliver value to the roughly 15 million Australians who hold a policy.

title.children: Value of private health insurance 'eroding' as doctors urge reform

image.altText: ADHD thumbnail

props.synopsis: International Day of People with Disability scholar Mark du Potiers shares how attention deficit hyperactivity disorder impacts him day-to-day and what he does to make life more manageable.

title.children: Living with ADHD can feel like fighting your own brain. Here's how I manage it

image.altText: A person holds up a phone showing the Google search web page.

props.synopsis: Pornographic image results will be blurred and searches for self-harm information will redirect to mental health supports under new Australian online safety codes.

title.children: Search engines will soon have to blur porn image results in Australia

image.altText: People at beach

props.synopsis: The burst of heat is short and sharp in southern states, sending temperatures more than 10 degrees Celsius above average and raising fire dangers to extreme, with the heat to linger into next week in the northern outback.

title.children: Heatwave could mark start to one of Australia's hottest summers arrival

image.altText: An artist's projection of the Hydrostor facility near Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill will be the location of Australia's first large-scale compressed air energy storage system. What is it and how does it work?

title.children: Compressed air energy storage is coming, but how does it work?

image.altText: Generic education school shots in a classroom with books and pencils.

props.synopsis: Forty-one signatories to an open letter say they are "dismayed" and that school rankings cause "harm to our communities".

title.children: News Corp refuses to publish open letter attacking its NAPLAN coverage

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: From a send-up of Hollywood studios to a chilling depiction of violence and masculinity to an age-appropriate reality TV romance, these are our favourite TV shows of 2025.

title.children: The 10 best TV shows that kept us glued to our screens in 2025

image.altText: Police tape across a car park outside a world gym.

props.synopsis: Police swam on a shopping centre in south-western Sydney after a man narrowly avoided injury after being shot at.

title.children: Police swarm Sydney gym after shots fired at man

image.altText: A close up portrait of a female Pacific Islander looking to the side with her face in profile

props.synopsis: Pacific Islanders have been leaving Australia's guest worker scheme, a decision that breaches their visa conditions and leaves them "extremely vulnerable".

title.children: Pacific guest workers are leaving their employers. We asked them why

image.altText: Red wax tipped bananas in box at packing shed.

props.synopsis: Red-tipped bananas are not new to Australian consumers, but they have gone viral on social media this month after an inquisitive post from two bewildered British backpackers.

title.children: Australia's red-tipped bananas go viral after cheeky social media post

image.altText: OpenAI signs deal with UNSW

props.synopsis: The company that brought AI into household vernacular is launching in Australia today. It comes as other companies like Meta are struggling to make traction in this space. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ChatGPT's owner OpenAI launching in Australia

image.altText: Yasser Abu Shabab wears a combat vest and holds a rifle as he sits and poses for a picture.

image.altText: Tim Wilson speaks in parliament house.

props.synopsis: The Liberals argue Labor's industrial relations concessions to the unions are a "handbrake on productivity" but this area has been tricky for the Coalition since John Howard's disastrous overreach.Â

title.children: Industrial relations are tricky for the Liberals since John Howard's disastrous overreach

image.altText: Vincent tarzia speaking in front of media microphones next to parliament building

title.children: SA Opposition Leader Vincent Tarzia says he is 'not bitter' as he steps down from leadership

props.synopsis: The final supermoon of the year is set to delight stargazers tonight. Here's how to spot it.

title.children: How to see the last supermoon of the year from your city

image.altText: A man wearing a cap walking by while on mobile phone.

props.synopsis: WA gold miners are stockpiling millions of dollars worth of the precious metal, believing it is more valuable than cash in the current environment. Â

title.children: Reclusive millionaire builds massive gold stockpiles amid record prices

image.altText: A group of delighted Socceroos players run away from the goal after scoring in a World Cup qualifier.

title.children: Behich, Socceroos eyeing rematch against World Cup giants

image.altText: two hands grasping prison bars

props.synopsis: Children as young as 14 years old could spend life in prison for some violent crimes after the Victorian parliament passed a controversial bill on Thursday. So what are the changes?

title.children: 'Adult Time for Violent Crime' laws pass Victorian parliament

image.altText: A woman with black hair

props.synopsis: A Law Enforcement Conduct Commission is examining why it took police officers nearly an hour to respond to a Triple Zero (000) call about an assault which left Lindy Lucena dead at the hands of her partner.

title.children: Officer's claim about search for woman killed by partner tested at watchdog hearing

image.altText: Marc Pfister, Christian Haller, Alan Frei and Enrico Pfister hug

props.synopsis: The idea of the Philippines curling team reaching the Winter Olympics has a hint of Cool Runnings about it, while one team member, Alan Frei, has more than a suggestion of Eddie the Eagle. But at the heart of this story is a genuine sporting fairytale that is one step away from becoming an Olympic legend.

title.children: Curling's most unlikely fairytale on the cusp of Olympic spot

image.altText: US defense secretary pete hegseth smirks at the camera

props.synopsis: The 84-page report finds US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated policy and could have put American troops at risk when he used the Signal app to discuss military strikes in Yemen.

title.children: Pentagon watchdog releases report on Hegseth's use of Signal app

image.altText: A person in a hoodie carries an item around the corner of a building.

props.synopsis: The arrest marks the first time investigators have settled on a suspect in an act that had long vexed law enforcement and spawned a multitude of conspiracy theories.

title.children: FBI arrests suspect over pipe bombs planted on eve of 2021 US Capitol riot

image.altText: A cylandrical military device on sandy ground

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force's bomb disposal squad responds to about 500 unexploded ordnance incidents a year, with many of the devices washing up on beaches.

title.children: Unexploded military devices washing up on beaches 'all over Australia'
